speaker: LEONATO
line: I learn in this letter that Don Peter of Arragon

speaker: LEONATO
line: comes this night to Messina.

speaker: Messenger
line: He is very near by this: he was not three leagues off

speaker: Messenger
line: when I left him.

speaker: LEONATO
line: How many gentlemen have you lost in this action?

speaker: Messenger
line: But few of any sort, and none of name.

speaker: LEONATO
line: A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings

speaker: LEONATO
line: home full numbers. I find here that Don Peter hath

speaker: LEONATO
line: bestowed much honour on a young Florentine called Claudio.

speaker: Messenger
line: Much deserved on his part and equally remembered by

speaker: Messenger
line: Don Pedro: he hath borne himself beyond the

speaker: Messenger
line: promise of his age, doing, in the figure of a lamb,

speaker: Messenger
line: the feats of a lion: he hath indeed better

speaker: Messenger
line: bettered expectation than you must expect of me to

speaker: Messenger
line: tell you how.

speaker: LEONATO
line: He hath an uncle here in Messina will be very much

speaker: LEONATO
line: glad of it.

speaker: Messenger
line: I have already delivered him letters, and there

speaker: Messenger
line: appears much joy in him; even so much that joy could

speaker: Messenger
line: not show itself modest enough without a badge of

speaker: Messenger
line: bitterness.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Did he break out into tears?

speaker: Messenger
line: In great measure.

speaker: LEONATO
line: A kind overflow of kindness: there are no faces

speaker: LEONATO
line: truer than those that are so washed. How much

speaker: LEONATO
line: better is it to weep at joy than to joy at weeping!

speaker: BEATRICE
line: I pray you, is Signior Mountanto returned from the

speaker: BEATRICE
line: wars or no?

speaker: Messenger
line: I know none of that name, lady: there was none such

speaker: Messenger
line: in the army of any sort.

speaker: LEONATO
line: What is he that you ask for, niece?

speaker: HERO
line: My cousin means Signior Benedick of Padua.

speaker: Messenger
line: O, he's returned; and as pleasant as ever he was.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: He set up his bills here in Messina and challenged

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Cupid at the flight; and my uncle's fool, reading

speaker: BEATRICE
line: the challenge, subscribed for Cupid, and challenged

speaker: BEATRICE
line: him at the bird-bolt. I pray you, how many hath he

speaker: BEATRICE
line: killed and eaten in these wars? But how many hath

speaker: BEATRICE
line: he killed? for indeed I promised to eat all of his killing.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Faith, niece, you tax Signior Benedick too much;

speaker: LEONATO
line: but he'll be meet with you, I doubt it not.

speaker: Messenger
line: He hath done good service, lady, in these wars.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it:

speaker: BEATRICE
line: he is a very valiant trencherman; he hath an

speaker: BEATRICE
line: excellent stomach.

speaker: Messenger
line: And a good soldier too, lady.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: And a good soldier to a lady: but what is he to a lord?

speaker: Messenger
line: A lord to a lord, a man to a man; stuffed with all

speaker: Messenger
line: honourable virtues.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: It is so, indeed; he is no less than a stuffed man:

speaker: BEATRICE
line: but for the stuffing,--well, we are all mortal.

speaker: LEONATO
line: You must not, sir, mistake my niece. There is a

speaker: LEONATO
line: kind of merry war betwixt Signior Benedick and her:

speaker: LEONATO
line: they never meet but there's a skirmish of wit

speaker: LEONATO
line: between them.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Alas! he gets nothing by that. In our last

speaker: BEATRICE
line: conflict four of his five wits went halting off, and

speaker: BEATRICE
line: now is the whole man governed with one: so that if

speaker: BEATRICE
line: he have wit enough to keep himself warm, let him

speaker: BEATRICE
line: bear it for a difference between himself and his

speaker: BEATRICE
line: horse; for it is all the wealth that he hath left,

speaker: BEATRICE
line: to be known a reasonable creature. Who is his

speaker: BEATRICE
line: companion now? He hath every month a new sworn brother.

speaker: Messenger
line: Is't possible?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Very easily possible: he wears his faith but as

speaker: BEATRICE
line: the fashion of his hat; it ever changes with the

speaker: BEATRICE
line: next block.

speaker: Messenger
line: I see, lady, the gentleman is not in your books.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: No; an he were, I would burn my study. But, I pray

speaker: BEATRICE
line: you, who is his companion? Is there no young

speaker: BEATRICE
line: squarer now that will make a voyage with him to the devil?

speaker: Messenger
line: He is most in the company of the right noble Claudio.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: O Lord, he will hang upon him like a disease: he

speaker: BEATRICE
line: is sooner caught than the pestilence, and the taker

speaker: BEATRICE
line: runs presently mad. God help the noble Claudio! if

speaker: BEATRICE
line: he have caught the Benedick, it will cost him a

speaker: BEATRICE
line: thousand pound ere a' be cured.

speaker: Messenger
line: I will hold friends with you, lady.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Do, good friend.

speaker: LEONATO
line: You will never run mad, niece.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: No, not till a hot January.

speaker: Messenger
line: Don Pedro is approached.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Good Signior Leonato, you are come to meet your

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: trouble: the fashion of the world is to avoid

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: cost, and you encounter it.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Never came trouble to my house in the likeness of

speaker: LEONATO
line: your grace: for trouble being gone, comfort should

speaker: LEONATO
line: remain; but when you depart from me, sorrow abides

speaker: LEONATO
line: and happiness takes his leave.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: You embrace your charge too willingly. I think this

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: is your daughter.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Her mother hath many times told me so.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Were you in doubt, sir, that you asked her?

speaker: LEONATO
line: Signior Benedick, no; for then were you a child.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: You have it full, Benedick: we may guess by this

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: what you are, being a man. Truly, the lady fathers

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: herself. Be happy, lady; for you are like an

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: honourable father.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: If Signior Leonato be her father, she would not

speaker: BENEDICK
line: have his head on her shoulders for all Messina, as

speaker: BENEDICK
line: like him as she is.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: I wonder that you will still be talking, Signior

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Benedick: nobody marks you.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: What, my dear Lady Disdain! are you yet living?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Is it possible disdain should die while she hath

speaker: BEATRICE
line: such meet food to feed it as Signior Benedick?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Courtesy itself must convert to disdain, if you come

speaker: BEATRICE
line: in her presence.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain I

speaker: BENEDICK
line: am loved of all ladies, only you excepted: and I

speaker: BENEDICK
line: would I could find in my heart that I had not a hard

speaker: BENEDICK
line: heart; for, truly, I love none.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: A dear happiness to women: they would else have

speaker: BEATRICE
line: been troubled with a pernicious suitor. I thank God

speaker: BEATRICE
line: and my cold blood, I am of your humour for that: I

speaker: BEATRICE
line: had rather hear my dog bark at a crow than a man

speaker: BEATRICE
line: swear he loves me.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: God keep your ladyship still in that mind! so some

speaker: BENEDICK
line: gentleman or other shall 'scape a predestinate

speaker: BENEDICK
line: scratched face.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Scratching could not make it worse, an 'twere such

speaker: BEATRICE
line: a face as yours were.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Well, you are a rare parrot-teacher.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of yours.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I would my horse had the speed of your tongue, and

speaker: BENEDICK
line: so good a continuer. But keep your way, i' God's

speaker: BENEDICK
line: name; I have done.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: You always end with a jade's trick: I know you of old.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: That is the sum of all, Leonato. Signior Claudio

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: and Signior Benedick, my dear friend Leonato hath

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: invited you all. I tell him we shall stay here at

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: the least a month; and he heartily prays some

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: occasion may detain us longer. I dare swear he is no

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: hypocrite, but prays from his heart.

speaker: LEONATO
line: If you swear, my lord, you shall not be forsworn.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Let me bid you welcome, my lord: being reconciled to

speaker: LEONATO
line: the prince your brother, I owe you all duty.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: I thank you: I am not of many words, but I thank

speaker: DON JOHN
line: you.

speaker: LEONATO
line: Please it your grace lead on?

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Your hand, Leonato; we will go together.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Benedick, didst thou note the daughter of Signior Leonato?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I noted her not; but I looked on her.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Is she not a modest young lady?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Do you question me, as an honest man should do, for

speaker: BENEDICK
line: my simple true judgment; or would you have me speak

speaker: BENEDICK
line: after my custom, as being a professed tyrant to their sex?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: No; I pray thee speak in sober judgment.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Why, i' faith, methinks she's too low for a high

speaker: BENEDICK
line: praise, too brown for a fair praise and too little

speaker: BENEDICK
line: for a great praise: only this commendation I can

speaker: BENEDICK
line: afford her, that were she other than she is, she

speaker: BENEDICK
line: were unhandsome; and being no other but as she is, I

speaker: BENEDICK
line: do not like her.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Thou thinkest I am in sport: I pray thee tell me

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: truly how thou likest her.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Would you buy her, that you inquire after her?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Can the world buy such a jewel?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Yea, and a case to put it into. But speak you this

speaker: BENEDICK
line: with a sad brow? or do you play the flouting Jack,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: to tell us Cupid is a good hare-finder and Vulcan a

speaker: BENEDICK
line: rare carpenter? Come, in what key shall a man take

speaker: BENEDICK
line: you, to go in the song?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever I

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: looked on.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I can see yet without spectacles and I see no such

speaker: BENEDICK
line: matter: there's her cousin, an she were not

speaker: BENEDICK
line: possessed with a fury, exceeds her as much in beauty

speaker: BENEDICK
line: as the first of May doth the last of December. But I

speaker: BENEDICK
line: hope you have no intent to turn husband, have you?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I would scarce trust myself, though I had sworn the

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: contrary, if Hero would be my wife.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Is't come to this? In faith, hath not the world

speaker: BENEDICK
line: one man but he will wear his cap with suspicion?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Shall I never see a bachelor of three-score again?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Go to, i' faith; an thou wilt needs thrust thy neck

speaker: BENEDICK
line: into a yoke, wear the print of it and sigh away

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Sundays. Look Don Pedro is returned to seek you.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: What secret hath held you here, that you followed

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: not to Leonato's?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I would your grace would constrain me to tell.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: I charge thee on thy allegiance.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: You hear, Count Claudio: I can be secret as a dumb

speaker: BENEDICK
line: man; I would have you think so; but, on my

speaker: BENEDICK
line: allegiance, mark you this, on my allegiance. He is

speaker: BENEDICK
line: in love. With who? now that is your grace's part.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Mark how short his answer is;--With Hero, Leonato's

speaker: BENEDICK
line: short daughter.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: If this were so, so were it uttered.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Like the old tale, my lord: 'it is not so, nor

speaker: BENEDICK
line: 'twas not so, but, indeed, God forbid it should be

speaker: BENEDICK
line: so.'

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: If my passion change not shortly, God forbid it

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: should be otherwise.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Amen, if you love her; for the lady is very well worthy.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: By my troth, I speak my thought.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And, in faith, my lord, I spoke mine.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: And, by my two faiths and troths, my lord, I spoke mine.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: That I love her, I feel.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: That she is worthy, I know.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: That I neither feel how she should be loved nor

speaker: BENEDICK
line: know how she should be worthy, is the opinion that

speaker: BENEDICK
line: fire cannot melt out of me: I will die in it at the stake.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Thou wast ever an obstinate heretic in the despite

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: of beauty.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And never could maintain his part but in the force

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: of his will.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: That a woman conceived me, I thank her; that she

speaker: BENEDICK
line: brought me up, I likewise give her most humble

speaker: BENEDICK
line: thanks: but that I will have a recheat winded in my

speaker: BENEDICK
line: forehead, or hang my bugle in an invisible baldrick,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: all women shall pardon me. Because I will not do

speaker: BENEDICK
line: them the wrong to mistrust any, I will do myself the

speaker: BENEDICK
line: right to trust none; and the fine is, for the which

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I may go the finer, I will live a bachelor.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: I shall see thee, ere I die, look pale with love.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: With anger, with sickness, or with hunger, my lord,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: not with love: prove that ever I lose more blood

speaker: BENEDICK
line: with love than I will get again with drinking, pick

speaker: BENEDICK
line: out mine eyes with a ballad-maker's pen and hang me

speaker: BENEDICK
line: up at the door of a brothel-house for the sign of

speaker: BENEDICK
line: blind Cupid.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Well, if ever thou dost fall from this faith, thou

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: wilt prove a notable argument.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: If I do, hang me in a bottle like a cat and shoot

speaker: BENEDICK
line: at me; and he that hits me, let him be clapped on

speaker: BENEDICK
line: the shoulder, and called Adam.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Well, as time shall try: 'In time the savage bull

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: doth bear the yoke.'

speaker: BENEDICK
line: The savage bull may; but if ever the sensible

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Benedick bear it, pluck off the bull's horns and set

speaker: BENEDICK
line: them in my forehead: and let me be vilely painted,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: and in such great letters as they write 'Here is

speaker: BENEDICK
line: good horse to hire,' let them signify under my sign

speaker: BENEDICK
line: 'Here you may see Benedick the married man.'

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: If this should ever happen, thou wouldst be horn-mad.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Nay, if Cupid have not spent all his quiver in

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Venice, thou wilt quake for this shortly.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I look for an earthquake too, then.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Well, you temporize with the hours. In the

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: meantime, good Signior Benedick, repair to

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Leonato's: commend me to him and tell him I will

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: not fail him at supper; for indeed he hath made

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: great preparation.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I have almost matter enough in me for such an

speaker: BENEDICK
line: embassage; and so I commit you--

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: To the tuition of God: From my house, if I had it,--

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: The sixth of July: Your loving friend, Benedick.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Nay, mock not, mock not. The body of your

speaker: BENEDICK
line: discourse is sometime guarded with fragments, and

speaker: BENEDICK
line: the guards are but slightly basted on neither: ere

speaker: BENEDICK
line: you flout old ends any further, examine your

speaker: BENEDICK
line: conscience: and so I leave you.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: My liege, your highness now may do me good.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: My love is thine to teach: teach it but how,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And thou shalt see how apt it is to learn

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Any hard lesson that may do thee good.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Hath Leonato any son, my lord?

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: No child but Hero; she's his only heir.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Dost thou affect her, Claudio?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: O, my lord,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: When you went onward on this ended action,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I look'd upon her with a soldier's eye,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: That liked, but had a rougher task in hand

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Than to drive liking to the name of love:

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: But now I am return'd and that war-thoughts

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Have left their places vacant, in their rooms

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Come thronging soft and delicate desires,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: All prompting me how fair young Hero is,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Saying, I liked her ere I went to wars.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Thou wilt be like a lover presently

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And tire the hearer with a book of words.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: If thou dost love fair Hero, cherish it,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And I will break with her and with her father,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And thou shalt have her. Was't not to this end

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: That thou began'st to twist so fine a story?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: How sweetly you do minister to love,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: That know love's grief by his complexion!

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: But lest my liking might too sudden seem,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I would have salved it with a longer treatise.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: What need the bridge much broader than the flood?

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: The fairest grant is the necessity.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Look, what will serve is fit: 'tis once, thou lovest,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And I will fit thee with the remedy.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: I know we shall have revelling to-night:

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: I will assume thy part in some disguise

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And tell fair Hero I am Claudio,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And in her bosom I'll unclasp my heart

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And take her hearing prisoner with the force

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And strong encounter of my amorous tale:

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Then after to her father will I break;

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And the conclusion is, she shall be thine.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: In practise let us put it presently.

speaker: LEONATO
line: How now, brother! Where is my cousin, your son?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: hath he provided this music?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: He is very busy about it. But, brother, I can tell

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: you strange news that you yet dreamt not of.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Are they good?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: As the event stamps them: but they have a good

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: cover; they show well outward. The prince and Count

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Claudio, walking in a thick-pleached alley in mine

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: orchard, were thus much overheard by a man of mine:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: the prince discovered to Claudio that he loved my

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: niece your daughter and meant to acknowledge it

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: this night in a dance: and if he found her

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: accordant, he meant to take the present time by the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: top and instantly break with you of it.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Hath the fellow any wit that told you this?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: A good sharp fellow: I will send for him; and

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: question him yourself.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: No, no; we will hold it as a dream till it appear

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: itself: but I will acquaint my daughter withal,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: that she may be the better prepared for an answer,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: if peradventure this be true. Go you and tell her of it.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Cousins, you know what you have to do. O, I cry you

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: mercy, friend; go you with me, and I will use your

scene: SCENE II.  A room in LEONATO's house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: skill. Good cousin, have a care this busy time.

speaker: CONRADE
line: What the good-year, my lord! why are you thus out

speaker: CONRADE
line: of measure sad?

speaker: DON JOHN
line: There is no measure in the occasion that breeds;

speaker: DON JOHN
line: therefore the sadness is without limit.

speaker: CONRADE
line: You should hear reason.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: And when I have heard it, what blessing brings it?

speaker: CONRADE
line: If not a present remedy, at least a patient

speaker: CONRADE
line: sufferance.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: I wonder that thou, being, as thou sayest thou art,

speaker: DON JOHN
line: born under Saturn, goest about to apply a moral

speaker: DON JOHN
line: medicine to a mortifying mischief. I cannot hide

speaker: DON JOHN
line: what I am: I must be sad when I have cause and smile

speaker: DON JOHN
line: at no man's jests, eat when I have stomach and wait

speaker: DON JOHN
line: for no man's leisure, sleep when I am drowsy and

speaker: DON JOHN
line: tend on no man's business, laugh when I am merry and

speaker: DON JOHN
line: claw no man in his humour.

speaker: CONRADE
line: Yea, but you must not make the full show of this

speaker: CONRADE
line: till you may do it without controlment. You have of

speaker: CONRADE
line: late stood out against your brother, and he hath

speaker: CONRADE
line: ta'en you newly into his grace; where it is

speaker: CONRADE
line: impossible you should take true root but by the

speaker: CONRADE
line: fair weather that you make yourself: it is needful

speaker: CONRADE
line: that you frame the season for your own harvest.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: I had rather be a canker in a hedge than a rose in

speaker: DON JOHN
line: his grace, and it better fits my blood to be

speaker: DON JOHN
line: disdained of all than to fashion a carriage to rob

speaker: DON JOHN
line: love from any: in this, though I cannot be said to

speaker: DON JOHN
line: be a flattering honest man, it must not be denied

speaker: DON JOHN
line: but I am a plain-dealing villain. I am trusted with

speaker: DON JOHN
line: a muzzle and enfranchised with a clog; therefore I

speaker: DON JOHN
line: have decreed not to sing in my cage. If I had my

speaker: DON JOHN
line: mouth, I would bite; if I had my liberty, I would do

speaker: DON JOHN
line: my liking: in the meantime let me be that I am and

speaker: DON JOHN
line: seek not to alter me.

speaker: CONRADE
line: Can you make no use of your discontent?

speaker: DON JOHN
line: I make all use of it, for I use it only.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: Who comes here?

speaker: DON JOHN
line: What news, Borachio?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: I came yonder from a great supper: the prince your

speaker: BORACHIO
line: brother is royally entertained by Leonato: and I

speaker: BORACHIO
line: can give you intelligence of an intended marriage.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: Will it serve for any model to build mischief on?

speaker: DON JOHN
line: What is he for a fool that betroths himself to

speaker: DON JOHN
line: unquietness?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: Marry, it is your brother's right hand.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: Who? the most exquisite Claudio?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: Even he.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: A proper squire! And who, and who? which way looks

speaker: DON JOHN
line: he?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: Marry, on Hero, the daughter and heir of Leonato.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: A very forward March-chick! How came you to this?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: Being entertained for a perfumer, as I was smoking a

speaker: BORACHIO
line: musty room, comes me the prince and Claudio, hand

speaker: BORACHIO
line: in hand in sad conference: I whipt me behind the

speaker: BORACHIO
line: arras; and there heard it agreed upon that the

speaker: BORACHIO
line: prince should woo Hero for himself, and having

speaker: BORACHIO
line: obtained her, give her to Count Claudio.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: Come, come, let us thither: this may prove food to

speaker: DON JOHN
line: my displeasure. That young start-up hath all the

speaker: DON JOHN
line: glory of my overthrow: if I can cross him any way, I

speaker: DON JOHN
line: bless myself every way. You are both sure, and will assist me?

speaker: CONRADE
line: To the death, my lord.

speaker: DON JOHN
line: Let us to the great supper: their cheer is the

speaker: DON JOHN
line: greater that I am subdued. Would the cook were of

speaker: DON JOHN
line: my mind! Shall we go prove what's to be done?

speaker: BORACHIO
line: We'll wait upon your lordship.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Was not Count John here at supper?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: I saw him not.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: How tartly that gentleman looks! I never can see

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: him but I am heart-burned an hour after.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: He is of a very melancholy disposition.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: He were an excellent man that were made just in the

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: midway between him and Benedick: the one is too

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: like an image and says nothing, and the other too

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: like my lady's eldest son, evermore tattling.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Then half Signior Benedick's tongue in Count John's

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: mouth, and half Count John's melancholy in Signior

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Benedick's face,--

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: With a good leg and a good foot, uncle, and money

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: enough in his purse, such a man would win any woman

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: in the world, if a' could get her good-will.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: By my troth, niece, thou wilt never get thee a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: husband, if thou be so shrewd of thy tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: In faith, she's too curst.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Too curst is more than curst: I shall lessen God's

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: sending that way; for it is said, 'God sends a curst

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: cow short horns;' but to a cow too curst he sends none.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: So, by being too curst, God will send you no horns.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Just, if he send me no husband; for the which

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: blessing I am at him upon my knees every morning and

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: evening. Lord, I could not endure a husband with a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: beard on his face: I had rather lie in the woollen.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: You may light on a husband that hath no beard.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: What should I do with him? dress him in my apparel

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: and make him my waiting-gentlewoman? He that hath a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: beard is less than a man: and he that is more than

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: man, I am not for him: therefore, I will even take

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: sixpence in earnest of the bear-ward, and lead his

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: apes into hell.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Well, then, go you into hell?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: No, but to the gate; and there will the devil meet

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: me, like an old cuckold, with horns on his head, and

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: say 'Get you to heaven, Beatrice, get you to

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: heaven; here's no place for you maids:' so deliver

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: I up my apes, and away to Saint Peter for the

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: heavens; he shows me where the bachelors sit, and

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: there live we as merry as the day is long.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To HERO  Well, niece, I trust you will be ruled

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: by your father.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Yes, faith; it is my cousin's duty to make curtsy

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: and say 'Father, as it please you.' But yet for all

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: that, cousin, let him be a handsome fellow, or else

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: make another curtsy and say 'Father, as it please

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: me.'

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Well, niece, I hope to see you one day fitted with a husband.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Not till God make men of some other metal than

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: earth. Would it not grieve a woman to be

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: overmastered with a pierce of valiant dust? to make

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: an account of her life to a clod of wayward marl?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: No, uncle, I'll none: Adam's sons are my brethren;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: and, truly, I hold it a sin to match in my kindred.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Daughter, remember what I told you: if the prince

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: do solicit you in that kind, you know your answer.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: The fault will be in the music, cousin, if you be

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: not wooed in good time: if the prince be too

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: important, tell him there is measure in every thing

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: and so dance out the answer. For, hear me, Hero:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: wooing, wedding, and repenting, is as a Scotch jig,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: a measure, and a cinque pace: the first suit is hot

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: and hasty, like a Scotch jig, and full as

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: fantastical; the wedding, mannerly-modest, as a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: measure, full of state and ancientry; and then comes

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: repentance and, with his bad legs, falls into the

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: cinque pace faster and faster, till he sink into his grave.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Cousin, you apprehend passing shrewdly.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: I have a good eye, uncle; I can see a church by daylight.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: The revellers are entering, brother: make good room.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Lady, will you walk about with your friend?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: So you walk softly and look sweetly and say nothing,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: I am yours for the walk; and especially when I walk away.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: With me in your company?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: I may say so, when I please.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And when please you to say so?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: When I like your favour; for God defend the lute

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: should be like the case!

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: My visor is Philemon's roof; within the house is Jove.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: Why, then, your visor should be thatched.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Speak low, if you speak love.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BALTHASAR
line: Well, I would you did like me.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: So would not I, for your own sake; for I have many

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: ill-qualities.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BALTHASAR
line: Which is one?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: I say my prayers aloud.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BALTHASAR
line: I love you the better: the hearers may cry, Amen.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: God match me with a good dancer!

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BALTHASAR
line: Amen.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: And God keep him out of my sight when the dance is

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: MARGARET
line: done! Answer, clerk.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BALTHASAR
line: No more words: the clerk is answered.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: I know you well enough; you are Signior Antonio.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: At a word, I am not.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: I know you by the waggling of your head.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: To tell you true, I counterfeit him.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: You could never do him so ill-well, unless you were

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: the very man. Here's his dry hand up and down: you

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: are he, you are he.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: At a word, I am not.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: Come, come, do you think I do not know you by your

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: excellent wit? can virtue hide itself? Go to,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: mum, you are he: graces will appear, and there's an

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: URSULA
line: end.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Will you not tell me who told you so?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: No, you shall pardon me.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Nor will you not tell me who you are?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Not now.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: That I was disdainful, and that I had my good wit

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: out of the 'Hundred Merry Tales:'--well this was

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Signior Benedick that said so.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: What's he?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: I am sure you know him well enough.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Not I, believe me.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Did he never make you laugh?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: I pray you, what is he?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Why, he is the prince's jester: a very dull fool;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: only his gift is in devising impossible slanders:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: none but libertines delight in him; and the

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: commendation is not in his wit, but in his villany;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: for he both pleases men and angers them, and then

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: they laugh at him and beat him. I am sure he is in

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: the fleet: I would he had boarded me.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: When I know the gentleman, I'll tell him what you say.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Do, do: he'll but break a comparison or two on me;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: which, peradventure not marked or not laughed at,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: strikes him into melancholy; and then there's a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: partridge wing saved, for the fool will eat no

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: supper that night.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: We must follow the leaders.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: In every good thing.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Nay, if they lead to any ill, I will leave them at

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: the next turning.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: Sure my brother is amorous on Hero and hath

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: withdrawn her father to break with him about it.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: The ladies follow her and but one visor remains.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BORACHIO
line: And that is Claudio: I know him by his bearing.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: Are not you Signior Benedick?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: You know me well; I am he.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: Signior, you are very near my brother in his love:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: he is enamoured on Hero; I pray you, dissuade him

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: from her: she is no equal for his birth: you may

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: do the part of an honest man in it.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: How know you he loves her?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: I heard him swear his affection.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BORACHIO
line: So did I too; and he swore he would marry her to-night.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON JOHN
line: Come, let us to the banquet.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Thus answer I in the name of Benedick,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: But hear these ill news with the ears of Claudio.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: 'Tis certain so; the prince wooes for himself.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Friendship is constant in all other things

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Save in the office and affairs of love:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Therefore, all hearts in love use their own tongues;

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Let every eye negotiate for itself

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And trust no agent; for beauty is a witch

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Against whose charms faith melteth into blood.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: This is an accident of hourly proof,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Count Claudio?

line: Come, will you go with me?

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Whither?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Even to the next willow, about your own business,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: county. What fashion will you wear the garland of?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: about your neck, like an usurer's chain? or under

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: CLAUDIO

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Why, that's spoken like an honest drovier: so they

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: sell bullocks. But did you think the prince would

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: Alas, poor hurt fowl! now will he creep into sedges.

line: But that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: know me! The prince's fool! Ha? It may be I go

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: am apt to do myself wrong; I am not so reputed: it

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK

line: Now, signior, where's the count? did you see him?

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: I found him here as melancholy as a lodge in a

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: warren: I told him, and I think I told him true,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: that your grace had got the good will of this young

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: lady; and I offered him my company to a willow-tree,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: The flat transgression of a schoolboy, who, being

speaker: BENEDICK
line: overjoyed with finding a birds' nest, shows it his

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: companion, and he steals it.

speaker: BENEDICK

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: you, who, as I take it, have stolen his birds' nest.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: I will but teach them to sing, and restore them to

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

speaker: BENEDICK

speaker: BENEDICK
line: you say honestly.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: The Lady Beatrice hath a quarrel to you: the

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: gentleman that danced with her told her she is much

speaker: BENEDICK
line: an oak but with one green leaf on it would have

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: answered her; my very visor began to assume life and

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: scold with her. She told me, not thinking I had been

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: myself, that I was the prince's jester, that I was

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: duller than a great thaw; huddling jest upon jest

line: with such impossible conveyance upon me that I stood

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: like a man at a mark, with a whole army shooting at

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: me. She speaks poniards, and every word stabs:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: if her breath were as terrible as her terminations,

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: there were no living near her; she would infect to

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: he transgressed: she would have made Hercules have

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: turned spit, yea, and have cleft his club to make

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: her the infernal Ate in good apparel. I would to God

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: some scholar would conjure her; for certainly, while

line: sanctuary; and people sin upon purpose, because they

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: Will your grace command me any service to the

line: him use for it, a double heart for his single one:

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: You have put him down, lady, you have put him down.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: So I would not he should do me, my lord, lest I

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE

speaker: DON PEDRO

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: though, I'll be sworn, if he be so, his conceit is

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

speaker: LEONATO

speaker: BEATRICE

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: father got excellent husbands, if a maid could come by them.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: No, my lord, unless I might have another for

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.

line: By my troth, a pleasant-spirited lady.

speaker: LEONATO
line: There's little of the melancholy element in her, my

scene: SCENE I.  A hall in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: lord: she is never sad but when she sleeps, and

line: To-morrow, my lord: time goes on crutches till love

line: things answer my mind.

line: despite of his quick wit and his queasy stomach, he
