line: thee the bucklers.

speaker: MARGARET
line: Give us the swords; we have bucklers of our own.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: If you use them, Margaret, you must put in the

speaker: BENEDICK
line: pikes with a vice; and they are dangerous weapons for maids.

speaker: MARGARET
line: Well, I will call Beatrice to you, who I think hath legs.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: And therefore will come.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: The god of love,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: That sits above,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: And knows me, and knows me,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: How pitiful I deserve,--

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I mean in singing; but in loving, Leander the good

speaker: BENEDICK
line: swimmer, Troilus the first employer of panders, and

speaker: BENEDICK
line: a whole bookful of these quondam carpet-mangers,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: whose names yet run smoothly in the even road of a

speaker: BENEDICK
line: blank verse, why, they were never so truly turned

speaker: BENEDICK
line: over and over as my poor self in love. Marry, I

speaker: BENEDICK
line: cannot show it in rhyme; I have tried: I can find

speaker: BENEDICK
line: out no rhyme to 'lady' but 'baby,' an innocent

speaker: BENEDICK
line: rhyme; for 'scorn,' 'horn,' a hard rhyme; for,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: 'school,' 'fool,' a babbling rhyme; very ominous

speaker: BENEDICK
line: endings: no, I was not born under a rhyming planet,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: nor I cannot woo in festival terms.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Sweet Beatrice, wouldst thou come when I called thee?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Yea, signior, and depart when you bid me.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: O, stay but till then!

speaker: BEATRICE
line: 'Then' is spoken; fare you well now: and yet, ere

speaker: BEATRICE
line: I go, let me go with that I came; which is, with

speaker: BEATRICE
line: knowing what hath passed between you and Claudio.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Only foul words; and thereupon I will kiss thee.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Foul words is but foul wind, and foul wind is but

speaker: BEATRICE
line: foul breath, and foul breath is noisome; therefore I

speaker: BEATRICE
line: will depart unkissed.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Thou hast frighted the word out of his right sense,

speaker: BENEDICK
line: so forcible is thy wit. But I must tell thee

speaker: BENEDICK
line: plainly, Claudio undergoes my challenge; and either

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I must shortly hear from him, or I will subscribe

speaker: BENEDICK
line: him a coward. And, I pray thee now, tell me for

speaker: BENEDICK
line: which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love with me?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: For them all together; which maintained so politic

speaker: BEATRICE
line: a state of evil that they will not admit any good

speaker: BEATRICE
line: part to intermingle with them. But for which of my

speaker: BEATRICE
line: good parts did you first suffer love for me?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Suffer love! a good epithet! I do suffer love

speaker: BENEDICK
line: indeed, for I love thee against my will.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: In spite of your heart, I think; alas, poor heart!

speaker: BEATRICE
line: If you spite it for my sake, I will spite it for

speaker: BEATRICE
line: yours; for I will never love that which my friend hates.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Thou and I are too wise to woo peaceably.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: It appears not in this confession: there's not one

speaker: BEATRICE
line: wise man among twenty that will praise himself.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: An old, an old instance, Beatrice, that lived in

speaker: BENEDICK
line: the lime of good neighbours. If a man do not erect

speaker: BENEDICK
line: in this age his own tomb ere he dies, he shall live

speaker: BENEDICK
line: no longer in monument than the bell rings and the

speaker: BENEDICK
line: widow weeps.

speaker: BEATRICE
line: And how long is that, think you?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Question: why, an hour in clamour and a quarter in

speaker: BENEDICK
line: rheum: therefore is it most expedient for the

speaker: BENEDICK
line: wise, if Don Worm, his conscience, find no

speaker: BENEDICK
line: impediment to the contrary, to be the trumpet of his

speaker: BENEDICK
line: own virtues, as I am to myself. So much for

speaker: BENEDICK
line: praising myself, who, I myself will bear witness, is

speaker: BENEDICK
line: praiseworthy: and now tell me, how doth your cousin?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Very ill.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: And how do you?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Very ill too.

speaker: BENEDICK
line: Serve God, love me and mend. There will I leave

speaker: BENEDICK
line: you too, for here comes one in haste.

speaker: URSULA
line: Madam, you must come to your uncle. Yonder's old

speaker: URSULA
line: coil at home: it is proved my Lady Hero hath been

speaker: URSULA
line: falsely accused, the prince and Claudio mightily

speaker: URSULA
line: abused; and Don John is the author of all, who is

speaker: URSULA
line: fed and gone. Will you come presently?

speaker: BEATRICE
line: Will you go hear this news, signior?

speaker: BENEDICK
line: I will live in thy heart, die in thy lap, and be

speaker: BENEDICK
line: buried in thy eyes; and moreover I will go with

speaker: BENEDICK
line: thee to thy uncle's.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Is this the monument of Leonato?

speaker: Lord
line: It is, my lord.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Reading out of a scroll

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Done to death by slanderous tongues

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Was the Hero that here lies:

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Death, in guerdon of her wrongs,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Gives her fame which never dies.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: So the life that died with shame

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Lives in death with glorious fame.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Hang thou there upon the tomb,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Praising her when I am dumb.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Now, music, sound, and sing your solemn hymn.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Pardon, goddess of the night,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Those that slew thy virgin knight;

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: For the which, with songs of woe,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Round about her tomb they go.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Midnight, assist our moan;

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Help us to sigh and groan,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Heavily, heavily:

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Graves, yawn and yield your dead,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Till death be uttered,

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Heavily, heavily.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Now, unto thy bones good night!

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Yearly will I do this rite.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Good morrow, masters; put your torches out:

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: The wolves have prey'd; and look, the gentle day,

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Before the wheels of Phoebus, round about

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Dapples the drowsy east with spots of grey.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Thanks to you all, and leave us: fare you well.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Good morrow, masters: each his several way.

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Come, let us hence, and put on other weeds;

speaker: DON PEDRO
line: And then to Leonato's we will go.

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And Hymen now with luckier issue speed's

speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Than this for whom we render'd up this woe.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: Did I not tell you she was innocent?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: So are the prince and Claudio, who accused her

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Upon the error that you heard debated:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: But Margaret was in some fault for this,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Although against her will, as it appears

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: In the true course of all the question.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Well, I am glad that all things sort so well.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: And so am I, being else by faith enforced

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: To call young Claudio to a reckoning for it.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Well, daughter, and you gentle-women all,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Withdraw into a chamber by yourselves,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: And when I send for you, come hither mask'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: The prince and Claudio promised by this hour

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: To visit me. You know your office, brother:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: You must be father to your brother's daughter

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: And give her to young Claudio.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: Which I will do with confirm'd countenance.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Friar, I must entreat your pains, I think.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: To do what, signior?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: To bind me, or undo me; one of them.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Signior Leonato, truth it is, good signior,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Your niece regards me with an eye of favour.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: That eye my daughter lent her: 'tis most true.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: And I do with an eye of love requite her.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: The sight whereof I think you had from me,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: From Claudio and the prince: but what's your will?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Your answer, sir, is enigmatical:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: But, for my will, my will is your good will

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: May stand with ours, this day to be conjoin'd

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: In the state of honourable marriage:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: In which, good friar, I shall desire your help.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: My heart is with your liking.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: And my help.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: Here comes the prince and Claudio.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Good morrow to this fair assembly.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Good morrow, prince; good morrow, Claudio:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: We here attend you. Are you yet determined

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: To-day to marry with my brother's daughter?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I'll hold my mind, were she an Ethiope.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Call her forth, brother; here's the friar ready.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: Good morrow, Benedick. Why, what's the matter,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: That you have such a February face,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: So full of frost, of storm and cloudiness?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I think he thinks upon the savage bull.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Tush, fear not, man; we'll tip thy horns with gold

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And all Europa shall rejoice at thee,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: As once Europa did at lusty Jove,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: When he would play the noble beast in love.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Bull Jove, sir, had an amiable low;

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: And some such strange bull leap'd your father's cow,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: And got a calf in that same noble feat

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Much like to you, for you have just his bleat.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: For this I owe you: here comes other reckonings.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Which is the lady I must seize upon?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: ANTONIO
line: This same is she, and I do give you her.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Why, then she's mine. Sweet, let me see your face.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: No, that you shall not, till you take her hand

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Before this friar and swear to marry her.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Give me your hand: before this holy friar,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I am your husband, if you like of me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: And when I lived, I was your other wife:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: And when you loved, you were my other husband.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Another Hero!

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: Nothing certainer:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: One Hero died defiled, but I do live,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: And surely as I live, I am a maid.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: The former Hero! Hero that is dead!

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: She died, my lord, but whiles her slander lived.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: All this amazement can I qualify:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: When after that the holy rites are ended,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: I'll tell you largely of fair Hero's death:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: Meantime let wonder seem familiar,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS
line: And to the chapel let us presently.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Soft and fair, friar. Which is Beatrice?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Unmasking  I answer to that name. What is your will?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Do not you love me?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Why, no; no more than reason.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Why, then your uncle and the prince and Claudio

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Have been deceived; they swore you did.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Do not you love me?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Troth, no; no more than reason.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Why, then my cousin Margaret and Ursula

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: Are much deceived; for they did swear you did.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: They swore that you were almost sick for me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: They swore that you were well-nigh dead for me.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: 'Tis no such matter. Then you do not love me?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: No, truly, but in friendly recompense.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: Come, cousin, I am sure you love the gentleman.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: And I'll be sworn upon't that he loves her;

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: For here's a paper written in his hand,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: A halting sonnet of his own pure brain,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: Fashion'd to Beatrice.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: And here's another

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: Writ in my cousin's hand, stolen from her pocket,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: HERO
line: Containing her affection unto Benedick.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: A miracle! here's our own hands against our hearts.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Come, I will have thee; but, by this light, I take

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: thee for pity.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: I would not deny you; but, by this good day, I yield

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: upon great persuasion; and partly to save your life,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BEATRICE
line: for I was told you were in a consumption.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Peace! I will stop your mouth.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: DON PEDRO
line: How dost thou, Benedick, the married man?

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: I'll tell thee what, prince; a college of

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: wit-crackers cannot flout me out of my humour. Dost

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: thou think I  care for a satire or an epigram? No:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: if a man will be beaten with brains, a' shall wear

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: nothing handsome about him. In brief, since I do

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: purpose to marry, I will think nothing to any

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: purpose that the world can say against it; and

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: therefore never flout at me for what I have said

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: against it; for man is a giddy thing, and this is my

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: conclusion. For thy part, Claudio, I did think to

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: have beaten thee, but in that thou art like to be my

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: kinsman, live unbruised and love my cousin.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: I had well hoped thou wouldst have denied Beatrice,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: that I might have cudgelled thee out of thy single

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: life, to make thee a double-dealer; which, out of

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: question, thou wilt be, if my cousin do not look

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: CLAUDIO
line: exceedingly narrowly to thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Come, come, we are friends: let's have a dance ere

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: we are married, that we may lighten our own hearts

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: and our wives' heels.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: LEONATO
line: We'll have dancing afterward.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: First, of my word; therefore play, music. Prince,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: thou art sad; get thee a wife, get thee a wife:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: there is no staff more reverend than one tipped with horn.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: Messenger
line: My lord, your brother John is ta'en in flight,

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: Messenger
line: And brought with armed men back to Messina.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Think not on him till to-morrow:

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: I'll devise thee brave punishments for him.

scene: SCENE IV.  A room in LEONATO'S house.
speaker: BENEDICK
line: Strike up, pipers.
